title: of the philosopher DEMOCRITUS, and a chronological register of dramatic writers. He was a prolific writer on an immense variety of subjects and was very learned, though he did not allow this quality to destroy the life of his poems. He was greatly admired and a great influence upon later poets, such as MELEAGER and, in particular, the Romans, Catullus and the neoterics and Propertius and the elegists
Loeb edition of his poems
Hellenistic Poetry and Art
Hellenistic Poetry
